subject: Automobile Racing
lead_paragraph: Hélio Castroneves won the PEAK Indy 300 in the second-closest finish in IndyCar Series history, but it was not enough to keep Scott Dixon from his second championship. Castroneves came from last place to win in Joliet, Ill., but Dixon, who knew he had to finish eighth or better to win the title, took the lead with a perfect late pit stop and nearly held off Castroneves, crossing the line inches behind the winner. After nearly 30 minutes, official timing and scoring called the margin of victory 0.0033 of a second.
